organizations.name: UN Special Mission to Observe the Act of Self-Determination
quotes: However, while leading the UN Special Mission to Observe the Act of Self-Determination in Niue, Salim and other advocates of self-determination realised that the concept could mean outcomes other than solely independence.

organizations.name: UN
quotes: The people of Niue asked the UN delegation led by Salim to negotiate on their behalf to be recognised as a New Zealand entity, instead of demanding full state independence.

organizations.name: UNGA
quotes: UNGA Resolution 3285 was consequently adopted, recognising the right of Niue to self-governance, but with economic and administrative support from the New Zealand government.

organizations.name: Special Committee on Decolonization
quotes: Similarly, the Special Committee on Decolonization supported the initial attempts for Puerto Rico’s bid for self-determination by reconsidering its status as a decolonised state, despite non-cooperation from the US, which maintained that Puerto Rico had already been decolonised and was part of the US ‘commonwealth’.

organizations.name: US
quotes: Although the UN had approved Puerto Rico’s association with the US in 1953 by removing it from the list of non-self-governing states and acknowledging the country as a commonwealth state, the Special Committee on Decolonization set a precedent

roles.title: chairman of the Special Committee on Decolonization
quotes: As chairman of the Special Committee on Decolonization, Salim, together with his colleagues, employed innovative strategies and took initiatives that would contribute to the liberation of people oppressed by colonial rule.

However, while leading the UN Special Mission to Observe the Act of Self-Determination in Niue, Salim and other advocates of self-determination realised that the concept could mean outcomes other than solely independence.
The people of Niue asked the UN delegation led by Salim to negotiate on their behalf to be recognised as a New Zealand entity, instead of demanding full state independence.
This resolution, however, only applied to the smaller colonised islands of the Caribbean and South Pacific.
This resolution, however, only applied to the smaller colonised islands of the Caribbean and South Pacific.

Similarly, the Special Committee on Decolonization supported the initial attempts for Puerto Rico’s bid for self-determination by reconsidering its status as a decolonised state, despite non-cooperation from the US, which maintained that Puerto Rico had already been decolonised and was part of the US ‘commonwealth’.

For instance, in 1972, in response to the continued denial by the Portuguese colonial government over the existence of the liberated areas in Guinea-Bissau, the committee decided to dispatch a team to the territory
